item.title: Scalar
item.description: Scalar # A worksheet Apple in HelloWorld.xlsx: HelloWorld.xlsx  Apple @TABLEAU ID Name Desc uint32 string string Item’s ID Item’s Name Item’s Description 1 Apple A kind of delicious fruit. In this worksheet, three scalar fields are defined:

item.title: Enum
item.description: Use predefined enum type # The basic enum guide, please go to read Enum → For example, enum type FruitType in common.proto is defined as: enum FruitType { FRUIT_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0 [(tableau.evalue).name = "Unknown"]; FRUIT_TYPE_APPLE = 1 [(tableau.evalue).name = "Apple"]; FRUIT_TYPE_ORANGE = 2 [(tableau.evalue).name = "Orange"]; FRUIT_TYPE_BANANA = 4 [(tableau.evalue).name = "Banana"]; } A worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.xlsx: HelloWorld.xlsx  ItemConf @TABLEAU ID Type map<uint32, Item> enum<.

item.title: Struct
item.description: Cross-cell struct # Syntax: <StructType>ColumnType. Each column name should be prefixed with the same struct variable name, which is just the same as struct type name by default. For example, a worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.xlsx: HelloWorld.xlsx  ItemConf @TABLEAU PropertyID PropertyName PropertyDesc {Property}int32 string string Property’s ID Property’s Name Property’s Description 1 Orange A kind of sour fruit.

item.title: Union
item.description: Theory # In protoconf, union type means the tagged union: a data structure used to hold a value that could take on several different, but fixed, types. Only one of the types can be in use at any one time, and a tag field explicitly indicates which one is in use. More details can be learned from wikipedia Tagged union. Tagged union in different programming languages: C++: std::variant. Rust: Defining an Enum.

item.title: List
item.description: Horizontal list # NOTE: Column name of horizontal list MUST have a digit suffix which started at 1. Overview of horizontal list syntax: List element type Syntax example scalar []uint32 enum []enum<.FruiteType> struct [Item]uint32 predefined struct [.Item]uint32 incell struct []{uint32 ID, string Num}Item incell predefined struct []{.Item} Horizontal scalar list # A worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.

item.title: Map
item.description: Horizontal map # There are some kinds of horizontal map: Horizontal scalar map, as map value type is scalar. E.g: map<int32, int32>. Horizontal struct map, as map value type is struct. E.g: map<int32, Item>. Horizontal predefined-struct map, as map value type is predefined struct. E.g: map<int32, .Item>. Horizontal scalar map # No need to support, use this instead: map<int32, Item>. Horizontal struct map # A worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.

item.title: KeyedList
Wellknown types
item.description: Datetime # Datetime # See Basics: Datetime → A worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.xlsx: HelloWorld.xlsx  ItemConf @TABLEAU BeginDatetime EndDatetime Datetime datetime datetime []datetime Begin datetime End datetime Datetime 2020-01-01 10:25:00 2022-10-10 05:10:00 2020-01-01 10:25:00,2022-10-10 05:10:00 Generated:

item.title: Struct in struct
item.description: Struct in struct # A worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.xlsx: HelloWorld.xlsx  ItemConf @TABLEAU RewardID RewardItemID RewardItemNum {Reward}int32 {Item}int32 int32 Reward’s ID Item’s ID Item’s num 1 1 10 Generated:

item.title: Struct in list
item.description: Nested in vertical-list # Struct in vertical-list # A worksheet ItemConf in HelloWorld.xlsx: HelloWorld.xlsx  ItemConf @TABLEAU ID Name PropID PropValue [Item]uint32 string {Prop}int32 int64 Item’s ID Item’s name Prop’s ID Prop’s value 1 Apple 1 10 2 Orange 2 20 3 Banana Generated:
